column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Worley's People Network Groups (PNGs) continue creating opportunities for its people to build awareness and community. These PNGs are key to Worley's culture and contribute to a workplace where everyone feels welcome.

column6: Parental leave
Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Worley's Health and Safety Management System is a risk-based system comprising risk processes, Standards, Procedures, Templates, Forms and Checklists. In alignment with ISO31000:2018 Risk Management standards, the risk-based approach establishes a series of risk control measures in managing worker health and safety. The Health and Safety Management System houses Worley's global minimum operating controls and applies them across its Group entities.
column20: Health and Safety Management System, risk control measure, operating control

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Worley applies effective risk management principles and processes for office and field activities. The risk management process is applied to identify, prioritise, prevent, minimise, mitigate, communicate and manage risks throughout all existing and planned activities.
column20: Risk management principles, field activity, office activity

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: All health and safety-related events are reported promptly into the Worley Assurance system. A communication protocol is in place to ensure the reporting is targeted to the level of management (and, where required, regulatory authorities) with a timeframe based on the event's severity. Immediately after any event, appropriate emergency response plans are activated, and the priority is the care of injured persons and the safety of all persons. Investigations are conducted by personnel trained in investigation techniques to identify and document contributing factors, root causes and systemic failures that contributed to the event.
column20: Worley Assurance, safety-related event, emergency response plan

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Worley continues to uphold the minimum standards that the Worley management system must meet. The Worley management system is certified to ISO 9001, and parts of its business hold ISO 45001 certification. Worley also conducts third-party audits of its management systems and metrics.
column20: Worley management system, ISO 9001, third-party audit

column6: Occupational health services
column13: Worley ensures the quality of occupational health services by using a qualified person to evaluate offsite medical providers and establishing a service agreement for the required services. Workers can access occupational health services through risk assessment, identifying the need for medical monitoring and treatment.
column20: Medical provider, occupational health service, service agreement

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: The management ensures suitable and sufficient consultation and communication with personnel concerning matters of HSE protection. Management considers the establishment of structured HSE Committees for offices and field sites. Many of Worley's locations' health and safety legislation sets guidelines for communication and consultation with personnel by establishing health and safety committees and representatives. Worley's local management fully complies with the structure and frequency of these requirements.
column20: HSE Committee, HSE protection, safety legislation

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: To ensure consistently high standards and compliance with local legal and other requirements, training and development solutions for critical HSE competencies, where possible, are provided by accredited independent providers wherever such provision is available. All new company personnel, including temporary and permanent transfers, contractors and visitors to any company-managed site, undergo a work location-specific induction introduced by a work location senior management team member.
column20: HSE competency, training and development, location-specific induction

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Worley's Mental Health Champions network continues to grow, with 307 Champions in over 31 countries. Worley also explored what psychosocial safety means in practice through Mental Health Week 2022 and Safety Week 2023 and will continue to develop this work.
column20: Mental Health Champions, Psychosocial Safety, Mental Health Week

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Worley's Ambassador program includes a well-being assessment and establishes a support network in each location. Worley piloted the program in South Africa and plans to roll it out to nine more locations by the end of FY2024.
column20: Ambassador program, well-being assessment, support network

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Worley's risk management principles and processes assist in reducing threats for all existing and planned activities, including those with significant negative occupational health and safety impacts. Worley implemented 'Life-saving rules' developed to draw attention to the activities most likely to lead to a fatality and the life-saving actions an individual controls. The rules support existing company management systems and risk control processes.
column20: Life-saving rule, fatality, life-saving action

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column8: Worley Safety, Health and Well-being and Sustainability Policies and Management System
column13: Contractors and suppliers must manage HSE in line with the Worley Safety, Health and Well-being and Sustainability Policies and Management System. Commensurate with risk, selecting any new or significant key supplier or contractor includes a review of HSE criteria and an HSE assessment. Contractors, when agreed through the company project engagement processes, may utilise their standards and procedures in so far as the requirements of their standards are at least equivalent to those of the Worley Management System, the customer's standards and those of applicable national and local regulations.
column20: Worley Safety, Health and Well-being and Sustainability Policies and Management System, HSE, Worley Management System

column6: Work-related injuries
column7: Worley had 56 cases of work-related injury in 2023.

column6: Work-related ill health
column7: Worley had two cases of work-related ill health in 2023.

column6: Average hours of training per year per employee
Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, Worley delivered refresher training in its Management and Knowledge Systems to over 4,600 leaders. Worley's leaders are significant in driving the right behaviours to achieve consistency and standardisation across its projects and operations. Additionally, Worley's people contributed over 500 improvement suggestions this year, supporting the continued enhancement of its systems.
column20: Management and Knowledge Systems, refresher training, standardisation

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Worley delivered five modules of the Data Centric Engineering training to more than 3,500 global attendees this year. Worley's learning modules continue to be used globally, with more than 16,000 digital passports completed, along with over 9,200 digital science stamps, 8,500 AI stamps, and 7,800 data literacy stamps completed since the launch of these modules.
column20: Data-centric engineering training, learning module, digital passport

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Worley launched its global recognition program, Appreciate. This program allows people to shine a light on their colleagues when they see Worley's values and behaviours. So far, Worley has seen 32,111 recognition moments.
column20: Appreciate, global recognition program, value, behaviour

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, Worley activated its leadership principles to create meaning, embrace possibility and deliver what matters. These principles outline Worley's expectations of leaders and help them bring Worley's purpose, ambition and values to life and lead through its transformation. Each principle is underpinned by habits that build inspirational leadership.
column20: Leadership principles, transformation, inspirational leadership

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Coaching capability is at the heart of Worley's leadership principles and a key skill for today's leaders. Worley delivered a pilot training program in Australia during FY2023 to build this skill with digital coaching prompts. These prompts combine behavioural science insights with the latest technology to create a new coaching experience for leaders.
column20: Coaching, leadership capability, digital coaching prompt

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In February 2023, Worley launched its new eLearning platform, Learning at Worley. Go1 powers the platform and offers learning modules that its people can access anywhere and anytime. Worley's people have completed over 26,000 learning modules, with over half of its learners completing more than two modules.
column20: Learning at Worley, eLearning, Go1

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Worley began its global STEM campaign in early 2022 to promote STEM as a career path within local communities. Worley continues to expand its network of ambassadors and volunteers who encourage and support STEM learning. Worley partnered with schools, colleges, universities and community groups to share its STEM expertise and knowledge. Worley's STEM events and activities include engineering workshops, mentoring programs and career events.
column20: STEM campaign, career path, local community

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Worley established a pilot Compliance Champions Network for its Cord business in Canada. Worley has expanded it across other Canadian sites, Mexico, and Mongolia. The network meets bi-monthly, including a training session and a takeaway ethics moment for participants to share with their teams. Topics covered during this period included discrimination and bullying, personal conflicts of interest, and modern slavery.
column20: Compliance Champions Network, training session, ethics moment

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Worley is proud to continue its involvement with Australia's Champions of Change Coalition. As part of this, Worley co-sponsored Shifting Expectations, a report on how more flexible frontline roles benefit business and diversity. Worley's representative, Gillian Cagney, President ANZ, attended the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women 67th Session in New York as part of the Champions of Change Coalition. During the session, Gillian contributed to round table discussions and shared gender equality practices.
column20: Shifting Expectations, Champions of Change Coalition, frontline role

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Worley's Diversity and Inclusion Policy includes requirements for the Board to establish measurable objectives for achieving diversity, including between genders, and to annually assess both those objectives and Worley's progress in achieving them. Worley's commitment to diversity and inclusion is supported by its Diversity and Inclusion expectations, which apply to all people regardless of the contracts or projects on which they are working.
column20: Diversity and Inclusion Policy, diversity, gender

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: In FY23, Worley addressed gender pay gaps during its annual salary review process and intends to continue with this approach. Worley trains its leaders on how to reduce bias when making remuneration decisions. Pay equity remains an area of focus in Worley's remuneration approach, and it applies learnings from its reporting in various jurisdictions.
column20: Gender pay gap, annual salary review, remuneration decision

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: Worley released a pay equity learning module for its leaders. It is designed to improve their understanding of pay equity and their role and equip them with the tools to make better-informed pay decisions.
column20: Pay equity learning module, pay decision, pay equity
